page.label: Input formats
page.par: Models and control parameters are read from a set of linked XML files. Each file covers a particular aspect of the model so that each file can be used in a range of different contexts and common modifications to the model often only involve switching one file for another.

The Model specification section of the user guide explains the structure of PSICS XML files, the various parameter types and how to set up complete models. This reference introduces each component type and tabulates all the allowed attributes (parameters) and elements (sub-objects).

ul.li: Run control: overall specification of the simulation to be performed
Environment: the environment around the cell, including the temperature and concentrations of ions
Ion channels: Kinetic Scheme channels, including Hodgkin-Huxley style models as multi-complex schemes
Electrical properties: resistance, capacitance and the distribution of ion channels
Stimulation and Recording: for attaching clamps and recorders to the structure that drive the simulation and specify what results are stored
Units: all physical quantities in any of the above components of the model should include the units in which they are expressed.
Standards: PSICS can read various external standards for model specification.
